379c162aac12eca2deca690287b54ad270cc2e40.name: Chet Haase
379c162aac12eca2deca690287b54ad270cc2e40.bio: Chet has been on the Android team since 2010, first as an engineer and then lead on the UI Toolkit team, then as Android's Chief Advocate on the developer relations team, and now as an engineer on the Android Graphics team. He enjoys hacking code for graphics, UI, performance, and then talking to developers about it at conferences like this.

4a7ca4c16cbe81a612bf3011a3d3439f85408103.name: Romain Guy
4a7ca4c16cbe81a612bf3011a3d3439f85408103.bio: Engineering director at Google on Android

1e8ee9b62ccbf4142710dbe7fde7bac48d1b5c96.name: Jeroen Mols
1e8ee9b62ccbf4142710dbe7fde7bac48d1b5c96.bio:
Jeroen Mols is a Google Developer Expert (GDE) in Android, an Android developer at Plaid and an international recognized speaker. With a passion for complex systems and highly technical apps, Jeroen has helped realize four connected products and over 15 Android applications.

Have a look at his portfolio https://jeroenmols.com

4227e79e90c24f18fa5d21d0f583b1ee263216bd.name: Sebastiano Poggi
4227e79e90c24f18fa5d21d0f583b1ee263216bd.bio:
“It depends” 🤷‍♂️

A Google Developers Expert 🤓 who has a serious thing for yellow, 💛 design ✨, and emojis 🤌

Package Search lead at JetBrains

6f31d29fa5a6aa10cae357cd9c1125f6018bc9ce.name: Arnaud Giuliani
6f31d29fa5a6aa10cae357cd9c1125f6018bc9ce.bio: Software developer for more than 14 years. Since a while now, I work as mainly as a Senior Android developer and keep hands in backend stuff. I'm working with Big companies as well as with startups. I'm a speaker since 2016. I talk mostly about Kotlin, Android & Koin. In 2017, I've created Koin (https://insert-koin.io), a lightweight dependency injection framework for Kotlin. I joined BlaBlaCar mobile team in 2020. I'm a Google Developer Expert for Kotlin since 2020.

37f10fced5aa69b828135567a03a2aaed66621d0.name: Marion Hayoun
37f10fced5aa69b828135567a03a2aaed66621d0.bio: Hello 👋 I'm Marion an Android Developer since 2012. For the past years I've been working at Dashlane contributing to our password manager and much more. I'm also leading the Paris Android User Group: https://www.meetup.com/Android-Paris/

fb805760b311d7dea7963afcd97f9613303f7722.name: Sandra Dupre
fb805760b311d7dea7963afcd97f9613303f7722.bio: Sr Android Eng Technical Lead for Disney Streaming. Lead of the Edna Team (Content discovery and UI Android team) for Disney+ and Star+

d2a0ee8397721dab722a6f969532df215dad171c.name: Anita Singh
d2a0ee8397721dab722a6f969532df215dad171c.bio: Anita Singh is a Group Engineering Lead at Gorillas who built the Android team from the ground up, and previously lead engineering teams at startups in Berlin and Silicon Valley. She currently manages engineering managers of multiple cross-functional teams and is still passionate about building beautiful and responsive apps, as well as making Android development more approachable for everybody.

7efc198c67dc2f4c71df042e3a7e7d16c601c976.name: Syrine Trabelsi
7efc198c67dc2f4c71df042e3a7e7d16c601c976.bio: Developpeuse android depuis presque 10 ans, j'ai commencé par travailler dans les agences avec des petites applications √† developper from scratch jusqu'a rejoindre des éditeurs ou je contribue a une grande application dans une équipe de développeurs.

a14457ee24a86a604c55d6774bed5483b630e78f.name: Eyal LEZMY
a14457ee24a86a604c55d6774bed5483b630e78f.bio:
- Android Lead at TAG Heuer
- Treasurer at the Paris Android User Group
- Co-organizer of Android Makers in Paris
- Google Developer Expert

I've been working with Android since 2009. I took part of several R&D projects at french internet providers, then at Samsung in the Android B2B team, I also built an Android set-top box for a hotel chain, worked several years on Genymotion, an Android emulator. Then I joined Qonto a French B2B bank to build their Android app. And in 2019 I joined TAG Heuer to build their connected watches and ecosystem.

796eb17edbb8dcd0f24ffd465235ab05beb57018.name: Alejandra Stamato
796eb17edbb8dcd0f24ffd465235ab05beb57018.bio: Alejandra is an Android Developer Relations Engineer working at Google, with focus on Jetpack Compose and UI. She previously worked on the Android apps for Web Summit, the technology conference, and the CRM platform HubSpot when based in Ireland and for the online travel agency Despegar.com in Latin America.

289e5c0e7494a73fc56ebc509dfe5aa9a1d564c2.name: Florina Muntenescu
289e5c0e7494a73fc56ebc509dfe5aa9a1d564c2.bio: Florina is working as an Android Developer Relations Engineer at Google, helping developers build beautiful apps with Jetpack Compose. She has been working with Android for more than 10 years, previous work covering news at upday, payment solutions at payleven and navigation services at Garmin.

b0a55542e9138934c5395898531fe9394525b04e.name: Jolanda Verhoef
b0a55542e9138934c5395898531fe9394525b04e.bio: Jolanda works as an Android Developer Advocate at Google. She helps developers write high-quality accessible and testable Compose code. Since writing and publishing her first Android app over 10 years ago, she has created apps for news startup Blendle, consumer electronics store Coolblue, and the Covid Exposure Notification app in the Netherlands.

2a2a587770ac71e14bdc82a6115575632f3401e0.name: Fanny Demey
2a2a587770ac71e14bdc82a6115575632f3401e0.bio: Fanny développe dans tout un tas de domaine depuis plus de 10 ans, en particulier du mobile sur Android. C'est une Lilloise engagée pour la communauté, Présidente du GDG Lille, organisatrice du DevFest Lille. Elle est également engagée pour l'accessibilité, vous pouvez l'entendre en tant que host sur le podcast TechEthic. Actuellement freelance, elle travaille exclusivement sur des projets avec une forte dimension éthique.

8fa3cb19406c7ae83ce2695ce8b4dfa75648d074.name: Gerard Paligot
8fa3cb19406c7ae83ce2695ce8b4dfa75648d074.bio: Mari et père de famille, je bosse chez Decathlon Technology comme Software Staff Engineer. Je suis également organisateur du GDG Lille, Lille Android User Group et du French Android User Group et très grand fan de Disney !

9c664410ea429bd31e4103fb1eb6e2bbe7b7f34f.name: Effie Barak
9c664410ea429bd31e4103fb1eb6e2bbe7b7f34f.bio: I'm an experienced Android speaker and a GDE. I work as the Android Tech lead in a Lottie, a Berlin based company developing a unique kids experience tablets for children. Before moving to Berlin, I worked at Quizlet as a Senior Android developer on the Android infrastructure team Before that I worked at Pinterest as a Senior Android developer on the Android Performance – Core Experience team, and before that I was a Senior Android developer at Udemy.

efd0a931724dbd49a6e5b9e6883cc57230a26149.name: Martin Bonnin
efd0a931724dbd49a6e5b9e6883cc57230a26149.bio: Martin is a maintainer of Apollo Kotlin. He has been writing Android applications since Cupcake and fell in love with Kotlin in 2017. Martin loves naming things and the sound of his laptop fan compiling all these type-safe programs. When not busy rewriting all his bash scripts in Kotlin, Martin loves to hike the Pyr√©n√©es or play a good game of Hearthstone.

04c52b8f992c37bd782f5ccfc1723d4a4167ae38.name: Benoit Lubek
04c52b8f992c37bd782f5ccfc1723d4a4167ae38.bio: Currently working on Apollo-Kotlin, the Kotlin SDK for GraphQL, Benoit has been writing software for 20 years, with a focus on Android since its v1. When he’s not coding, you can find him enjoying movies or geocaching.

fe6c3c11932ad7f6909cb219770c7b331b2d80ed.name: Divya Jain
fe6c3c11932ad7f6909cb219770c7b331b2d80ed.bio: I'm a Lead Android Developer, currently working on Hi-Road Auto Insurance App. I am an Android Enthusiast, also experimenting & learning other mobile frameworks like IOS, React Native with a goal to become a Holistic Mobile App Developer I've been working on Mobile Apps (Android) for over 7 years and I love to create useful and user-friendly apps to make lives more easy and happy. You will also find me blogging about my code experiments and things I learn. I also speak at conferences and love traveling the world.

b59333a429b238f81f8c0a6377da8c8f052f917f.name: Julien Salvi
b59333a429b238f81f8c0a6377da8c8f052f917f.bio: Into the Android world for 10 years, I experienced California the startup way of life before coming back to France. I am currently a Lead Android Engineer at Aircall where we are building the best phone system for modern businesses. Alongside Android, I have a great interest in backend development with Kotlin and AR/VR technology. In 2021, I became an Android GDE to continue my journey to always share and learn with the Android community. On my spare time, I am a world traveler and a beer lover always looking for the best IPAs!

9cca77d49733a147693723113dfd3cc90da2cb32.name: Guilherme Branco
9cca77d49733a147693723113dfd3cc90da2cb32.bio: Android Engineer working on Disney+ and Star+ apps at Disney Streaming. I have been working as a Software Engineer for more than 10 years, 8 of them building mobile apps from Games to Video Streaming.

1618306a9218b5a69ca5a1fa17b1a7ee0ffa7d95.name: Anna B√°tki
1618306a9218b5a69ca5a1fa17b1a7ee0ffa7d95.bio: Anna knows (almost) everything about mobile CI/CD, because she has worked at Bitrise for 5 years, enabling the world‚Äôs most successful mobile organizations to deploy high-quality apps efficiently. She is a passionate learner who holds the unique position to understand complex technical issues and customer pain points. She enjoys deep diving into engineering workflows, authoring technical blog posts and product communications, as well as presenting at developer conferences such as DevFests. She loves to organize and optimize, tell stories, and share her experience, especially the nerdy things - in an easy-to-understand and fun way.

ab12cba820c3cdd5f9ac0dd86acc8be4360308bd.name: Antoine Danois
ab12cba820c3cdd5f9ac0dd86acc8be4360308bd.bio:
Antoine is an Android Developer at Citymapper, London. Before that, he worked at Canal+ in Paris. When he's not working to help people catch their buses, he's watching videos of rockets and other space related things.

Part of the droidcon London & Android Makers Program Committee, he's doing his best to have amazing conferences in London and in Paris, because the community is really important in the world of Android. And otherwise, he's just eating cheese.

871b279eaaf5863eb98307a1254815fadf6ac8b8.name: Oussama Hafferssas
871b279eaaf5863eb98307a1254815fadf6ac8b8.bio: Android platform engineer at Trainline. Having a background of 5 years of crafting Android apps for millions of french banks users. Oussama believes that there is always a room to learn, and sharing knowledge as a mean to acquire more.

261f7a484edbadf864016e371f31f749475178d6.name: Liam Spradlin
261f7a484edbadf864016e371f31f749475178d6.bio: I’m a designer at Google, working on Material Design. I’ve helped independent developers, startups, and civic organizations invent or improve great human-centered experiences, with a focus on the future of interface design across platforms. I also host a podcast called Design Notes, exploring how creative work helps us relate to the world and each other.

81475c5c7df6a5dbd02305f38a07737bb040ff47.name: Zac Sweers
81475c5c7df6a5dbd02305f38a07737bb040ff47.bio: Zac is a mobile engineer at Slack with primary focus areas in Android, code gen, Kotlin, OSS, and avoiding sniffly APIs. He’s the creator of a few open source projects like AutoDispose, MoshiX, and CatchUp, and active contributor to several more.

3dc83a34a4378294fbabe71ace26dfe955a51b16.name: Alexey Bykov
3dc83a34a4378294fbabe71ace26dfe955a51b16.bio:
Hi.
I’m Alexey, Android Software Engineer & Android GDE based in London.

I work at Revolut where I take care of a platform-specific domain: build time, CI/CD, testing tools and common approaches & processes.

I got into software development thanks to people who are actively sharing knowledge by blog posts and free courses. This is why I spend a lot of my spare time sharing content with the community, and I have incredible fun doing it! In 2018, I organized Android Academy community in Moscow, which currently has more than a thousand people, who are educated for free.

Advocate of Kotlin, functional programming, Jetpack Compose & UI testing.

fdec3e91e4892c5b08988aa3f83443e366ed3a1c.name: Florian Mierzejewski
fdec3e91e4892c5b08988aa3f83443e366ed3a1c.bio: Software engineer with a strong mobile background. I’ve worked for widely different clients in various countries, on an even wider range of projects. From greenfield to enormous untested legacy codebase, I’ve seen glory and horror while always managing to have a positive impact. Eternal learner, you’ll always find me with a book, listening to a podcast or at a local meetup to improve what I know or discover something I don’t. TDD, clean code, best practices, pair programming but also empathy and compromise.

4be0e0e99b3e04c7154d73ee45444b80d459f466.name: Xavier F. Gouchet
4be0e0e99b3e04c7154d73ee45444b80d459f466.bio: Xavier F. Gouchet is a Senior Software Engineer at Datadog, experienced public speaker, and proud father. Passionate about open source, testing and architecture, he has been dabbling in Android since the Cupcake days and has been working as a professional Android engineer since 2012.

24f7fbc170f9551fd4e319336666bcbffb34daa4.name: Ben Kadel
24f7fbc170f9551fd4e319336666bcbffb34daa4.bio: Senior Android Developer at Babbel (Language learning app) with a deep passion for enabling all developers to understand some of the more complicated topics in the Software development world, such as Git. I love teaching/presenting & providing educational information to everyone in an easy-to-digest way, but I also find it important to provide some entertainment & smiles. I run my own developer tutorial YouTube channel, where I cover an array of different topics from "How to use the Terminal", Git, Android Development and even Vim!

d0233195e347b6929d84b4f2b3b9cf2084503bff.name: Simona Stojanovic
d0233195e347b6929d84b4f2b3b9cf2084503bff.bio: Simona Stojanovic works at Google as an Android Developer Relations Engineer, as part of the Jetpack Compose team. Before joining Google, Simona worked as an Android Dev in a variety of different industries - retail, transportation, banking, automotive & online dating. Aside from work, she loves to travel, read, organise stuff (😬), play music & video games and spend time with her 4 fluffy pets.

675ce05144893df92af77c3fb33b55065fc15911.name: Jean-Baptiste Vincey
675ce05144893df92af77c3fb33b55065fc15911.bio: Android developer & tech expert @Deezer, passionate about Design System, libraries and code sharing.

f1ccb89c189cf8565f3b9c96ea718f44ef227172.name: Renaud Mathieu
f1ccb89c189cf8565f3b9c96ea718f44ef227172.bio: Mostly building Android apps from Paris.

b514cfad0717c15c7614faa45290699332821266.name: Edouard Marquez
b514cfad0717c15c7614faa45290699332821266.bio:
Edouard est un développeur qui ne voyait que par le petit bonhomme vert d'Android, au point d'en collectionner 300 figurines chez lui (… doit être malade celui-là …).

Puis il s'est réveillé et à découvert Flutter et depuis il lui fait quelques infidélités.

7bac67d7d63904678bd159d5cf29aa842fa30719.name: Frédéric Torcheux
7bac67d7d63904678bd159d5cf29aa842fa30719.bio: Fell in love with Android since I had my first smartphone (Gingerbread <3), I dreamed to develop an application used by millions of people. At MWM, I developed several applications matching this wish ! I like to develop beautiful UI but also to write native code in C++ with Android NDK to maximize performance of algorithms.

502ccdc3af4586ba5aeca6e480c02d43b372a3aa.name: Pierre Issartel
502ccdc3af4586ba5aeca6e480c02d43b372a3aa.bio: Young Android developer, I’m a tech enthusiast and music lover. I have always been interested in new technologies, so I started to learn software engineering, electronics and embedded systems. What I like in mobile engineering is the possibility of either making friendly UIs or low-level development. At MWM, I can mix my interest in tech with my music passion!

85525b634cb11f3cf25a55f73903a92460b7778e.name: Enrique López Mañas
85525b634cb11f3cf25a55f73903a92460b7778e.bio: Enrique López Mañas is a software engineer, mostly focused on Android and backend development with Java/Kotlin. As a contractor, he has filled his hours with an eclectic variety of technologies: TensorFlow, iOS, Swift, NodeJS, RoR, and Python. Before Living by the Code, he published the books Android High Performance, 100 Android Questions and Answers, and 100 iOS Questions and Answers. He has been a member of the Google Developer Expert crew since 2014. Besides his programming duties, he also runs a few side projects. He is the editor and maintainer of Kotlin Weekly, a mailing list that delivers news about the Kotlin universe every Sunday. He is the organizer of Kotlin Users Meetup Group Munich and Droidcon Vietnam.

452bd8feee2751b292fda917b98cef8b242503d6.name: Iury Souza
452bd8feee2751b292fda917b98cef8b242503d6.bio: Software Engineer focused on mobile development. I'm also interested in FP, reactive programming, system design, and build automation!

b4c364ab6ed674a9aacc0b2ec0524ac1cf097578.name: Thierry LEE
b4c364ab6ed674a9aacc0b2ec0524ac1cf097578.bio: Dévelopeur Android à Octo Technology et féru de scripts Bash, Python & Kotlin. J'ai travaillé sur des projets avec des équipes comportant beaucoup de développeurs partageant les mêmes standards de code.

786f4ff40c2d8aeef85a8dc997006cae5a4f9dc3.name: Benoît Quenaudon
786f4ff40c2d8aeef85a8dc997006cae5a4f9dc3.bio: Android at Cash App. Like nice code.

5498b37176004d47f01ecb6d61bdead82ff63d9b.name: Márton Braun
5498b37176004d47f01ecb6d61bdead82ff63d9b.bio: Android Developer Relations Engineer at Google, working on anything and everything Kotlin. A fan of the language since the 1.0 release. Lecturer at BME-VIK, teaching a standalone Kotlin course. Creator of requireKTX, RainbowCake, and Krate. Ranked right around the very top of the Kotlin tag on StackOverflow.

2feb72725774e2b7ae864cafa8d2b6ac6c0cac32.name: Robin Caroff
2feb72725774e2b7ae864cafa8d2b6ac6c0cac32.bio:
Technical Lead at Resonantes (http://association.resonantes.fr/) where I am mostly developing the App-Elles Android and iOS app (https://app-elles.fr/).

Former Co-Founder and Director of the mobile application agency Toki.

Mobile developer since 2011, I am also Co-Founder and Organizer of the GDG Nantes Android (https://www.meetup.com/fr-FR/gdgnantesandroid/) and the FRAUG (French Android User Group - https://www.twitch.tv/frenchandroidusergroup).

Technology enthusiast, highly convinced that technology and mobile devices can improve productivity for small as well as for big companies.

109d33decd394492fbd5b99a92dd7607d821d27c.name: Elaine Dias Batista
109d33decd394492fbd5b99a92dd7607d821d27c.bio: Elaine is a Team Leader at SFEIR where she works on projects consisting of mobile and voice technologies. She's passionate about Android dev since 2013, having worked in several projects in native Android but also native iOS. She's particularly interested by voice technologies and its integration in mobile apps. Since 2018, her new passion is Flutter but she's still interested in native development and all of its possibilities :) She's a GDE for the Google Assistant, Flutter and Dart.

aaec18080e28068c1d725fb7747a77a26df8dcd8.name: Carlos Mota
aaec18080e28068c1d725fb7747a77a26df8dcd8.bio: Carlos Mota is an Android GDE. He can easily be spotted either working on Android applications written in Kotlin or developing them along with Kotlin Multiplatform. An enthusiastic for new technology and always trying to reach those last 20% of all of his side projects that seem to be really far away. He loves to share his knowledge with others either by giving talks, teaching, writing or along with a cold beer in the nearest pub. GDG Coimbra organizer and Kotlin evangelist, he also has a huge passion for travel, photography, space and the occasional run.

cb2e16407c778831b4f990bfbd556135c507867f.name: Louis CAD
cb2e16407c778831b4f990bfbd556135c507867f.bio:
Making open source projects, and projects as part of my own startup.

Kotlin GDE & Android Dev. Efficiency over performance. Recumbent bike commuter, velomobile enthusiast.

Do what's hard and your life will be easy‚Ä¶ [üîÅ

370e6c635f61bb5c39e82f411e8a639d0fdaf7ce.name: Jonathan Salamon
370e6c635f61bb5c39e82f411e8a639d0fdaf7ce.bio:
Android Developer @ Dashlane for almost 5 years, I work on innovative features with high expectations in terms of both performance and security.

Fan of new technologies (virtual reality, wearables, ..) I have been able to contribute (as employee, auto-entrepreneur or volunteer) to many projects involving cutting-edge technologies.

I love to learn and I'm happy to have been able to work on various domains such as web front-end/back-end apps, mobile game development, android apps targeting B2C/B2B audiences and even helped to create new wearables products.

8cf6953f3044bbd7a00c1da22f5df6b54be26b6f.name: Zhenlei Ji
8cf6953f3044bbd7a00c1da22f5df6b54be26b6f.bio:
Zhenlei is an Android engineer at N26 developing the first mobile bank app in Europe. He was previously part of the team at Venturus in Brazil, where he also got the chance to work with various partners (Sony Mobile, Motorola, etc) on their Android projects.

He has not only been developing for Android since Gingerbread but he also contributed to the AOSP (Android Open Source Project) in the Android Framework UI/UX team. He also has experience with test automation.

Besides that, he is an origami enthusiast that tries to fold a piece of paper in his spare time.

11c3eef1aefb87fb11d7beee2a2e4e891604b3e2.name: Hugo Gresse
11c3eef1aefb87fb11d7beee2a2e4e891604b3e2.bio:
Mobile developer for Pl@ntNet app at INRIA, Montpellier, France

Previously:
 - lead android developer at Teads

Also a web developer and open source contributors:
 - https://openfeedback.io
 - https://bataille.ovh

Créator of Montpellier Android User Group, board member of Montpellier Tech Hub and co-organizer of SunnyTech

65a10ef193706d1eac513be7fd840171227470ce.name: Pablo Gamito
65a10ef193706d1eac513be7fd840171227470ce.bio: Software Engineer at Google in the Android Framework team in Zurich with a focus on window management and animations, alongside the tooling to debug and prevent flickers during window animations.

7c3c8d4952ab519203050d818cb1f3d6193ec605.name: Vadim Caen
7c3c8d4952ab519203050d818cb1f3d6193ec605.bio: Vadim is a Software Engineer at Google. He worked on Android Studio during 3 years in London and is now part of the Android Framework team, working on the Window Manager.

e36f716f289dd08cc5c7fdf707c78c11e4b7a7ae.name: Yacine Rezgui
e36f716f289dd08cc5c7fdf707c78c11e4b7a7ae.bio: Yacine is an Android developer relations engineer at Google in London where his work is focused on privacy. He worked previously as a developer advocate at IBM on artificial intelligence API ecosystem and as a software engineer in several startups.

c9a8b648da77430c58904cc76bd0c95cc6d64624.name: Morad Azzouzi
c9a8b648da77430c58904cc76bd0c95cc6d64624.bio: More than 9 years of experience with a broad range of computer expertise. Currently Android Developer Senior at InnovOrder. Author of Anti-Theft Security and Auxilium apps.
